etymology.description: 游(遊) (yóu, "to swim; to travel") + 泳(泳) (yǒng, "to swim") = swim; swimming
etymology.interpretation: The word 游泳 (yóuyǒng) combines 游(遊) (yóu, "to swim; to travel") and 泳(泳) (yǒng, "to swim") to depict the action of swimming. It emphasizes the physical act as well as the potential enjoyment or leisure activity associated with it.

parts.english: to swim; to travel; to wander

examples.chinese: 我喜欢游泳(我喜歡游泳)。
夏天来了(夏天來了)，我们去游泳(我們去游泳)。
examples.english: When summer comes, we go swimming.

examples.chinese: 他每天练习游泳(他每天練習游泳)，以备参加比赛(以備參加比賽)。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān liànxí yóuyǒng, yǐ bèi cānjiā bǐsài.
examples.english: He practices swimming every day in preparation for competitions.
